options.description: If only one user is included, this creates a 1:1 DM. The ordering of the users is preserved whenever a multi-person direct message is returned. Supply a channel when not supplying users. Choose from the list, or specify IDs using an expression.

properties.name: otherOptions
properties.description: Other options to set

options.name: includeLinkToWorkflow
options.description: Whether to append a link to this workflow at the end of the message. This is helpful if you have many workflows sending Slack messages.

options.name: botProfile
options.description: Set an image or an emoji as the Profile Photo (avatar) of the bot sending the message. Will not be used if sending message as a user.

values.name: icon_emoji
values.description: Only used if sending message as a bot. Use emoji codes like +1, not an actual emoji like 👍. List of common emoji codes

values.name: icon_url
values.description: Only used if sending message as a bot

options.name: link_names
options.description: Whether to turn @users and #channels in message text into clickable links

options.name: thread_ts
options.description: Provide another message's Timestamp value to make this message a reply

values.name: thread_ts
values.description: Message timestamps are included in output data of Slack nodes, abbreviated to ts

values.name: reply_broadcast
values.description: Whether the reply should be made visible to everyone in the channel or conversation

options.name: mrkdwn
options.description: Whether to use Slack Markdown to format the message

options.name: unfurl_links
options.description: Whether to enable unfurling of primarily text-based content

options.name: unfurl_media
options.description: Whether to disable unfurling of media content

options.name: ephemeral
options.description: Whether to send a temporary, ephemeral message

values.name: ephemeral
values.description: Whether to send a temporary, ephemeral message

options.name: ephemeral
options.description: Whether to send a temporary, ephemeral message

options.name: sendAsUser
options.description: The message will be sent from this username (i.e. as if this individual sent the message). Add chat:write.customize scope on Slack API

hints.text: To create blocks, use Slack's Block Kit Builder
To create blocks, use Slack's Block Kit Builder

notes.name: Notes
notes.description: Optional note to save with the node

notesInFlow.name: Display Note in Flow?
notesInFlow.description: If active, the note above will display in the flow as a subtitle

alwaysOutputData.name: Always Output Data
alwaysOutputData.description: If active, will output a single, empty item when the output would have been empty. Use to prevent the workflow finishing on this node

executeOnce.name: Execute Once
executeOnce.description: If active, the node executes only once, with data from the first item it receives

retryOnFail.name: Retry On Fail
retryOnFail.description: If active, the node tries to execute again when it fails

maxTries.name: Max. Tries
maxTries.description: Number of times to attempt to execute the node before failing the execution

waitBetweenTries.name: Wait Between Tries (ms)
waitBetweenTries.description: How long to wait between each attempt (in milliseconds)

onError.name: On Error
onError.description: Action to take when the node execution fails

options.name: Stop Workflow
options.description: Halt execution and fail workflow

options.name: Continue
options.description: Pass error message as item in regular output

options.name: Continue (using error output)
options.description: Pass item to an extra `error` output

settings.note: Executable nodes have both common and executable settings
